intro: Erigeron glabratus var. albus, commonly known as the white fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its pale white to pale yellow flowers, which bloom in summer and are arranged in a composite head. The plant has fine, hairy leaves and a branched stem, often growing in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, known for its showy inflorescences and medicinal properties in some species. The white fleabane is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
